noun.description: A herbaceous plant widely cultivated as a source of food for humans and livestock, and for processing into sugar. Some varieties are grown for their leaves and some for their large nutritious root.
The edible dark red spherical root of a kind of beet, eaten as a vegetable.

origin: Old English bÄ“te, of West Germanic origin, from Latin beta, perhaps of Celtic origin; related to Dutch beet and German Bete.
